p: N-glycosylation sites at HA protein sequences were predicted by NetNGlyc 1.0 Server ( http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/NetNGlyc/). The evolution pattern of N-glycosylation sites on HA protein of H1N1 viruses was reported before; in this study, for all predicted potential N-glycosylation sites, only non-conserved ones were included in the machine learning model, as described elsewhere [ 7]. The non-conserved N-glycosylation sites at HA of A/Solomon Islands/03/2006(H1N1) (PDB accession number 5UG0) were further conserved using NGlycPred, which is a software predicting N-linked glycosylation sites incorporating structural information [ 47]. In addition, N-glycosylation sites, all amino acid residues, with a variant rate > 10%, will be considered as non-conserved sites and included in the machine learning model.
